page.title: 05Sleights Moor. P2
page.content:
The highest part of the moor,{Black {Brow,}is only{289 metres above sea level but the wide expanse of heather increases the impression of solitude and remoteness.
Some{black-faced sheep}still graze this upland but financial problems and sheep kills by road traffic have not encouraged management of the presently unfenced moorland habitat for sheep. {Sporting interest}however, also requires heather management and has been beneficial in some areas.Heather from productive stands has been used in attempts to reinstate sections elsewhere which were devasted by the fires of 1976.
This most distinctive habitat is thus still enjoyed by many.
